page.title: 09Farming in Brafferton
page.content:
The average size of farms in the area is between 180 and 200 acres.
{Mixed farming}is the most common type practised here.Crops grown include wheat which is grown for cash,barley which is grown for cattle feed,and grass for silage.There are also some potatoes,oil seed rape,and root crops such as beet.
{Cattle}is the main live-stock with the major variety being Friesian.The primary emphasis is on fattening for beef but there is also some dairying.
The area does contain some sheep on rough grazing as well as a few pigs kept for fattening for Christmas.
